column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r212519252315\r\r1\r231522152214\r\r2\r255254254\r\r3\r254235244\r\r4\r3325281133212\r\r5\r306122342715\r\rOther**\r\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement121212\r\rProfessional development is a critical and extensive service provided by the Moreno Valley Unified School District (MVUSD) focused on supporting the\rimplementation of the district’s strategic plan which include specific goals and outcomes. The fourteen outcomes are:\r\r•Increase the Distance from Standard in grades 3-8 and 11 SBAC ELA and Math by 10% of the Distance from Standard.\r•Progressively increase the number of students who meet their expected growth as measured by the Achievement Status Growth report in\rthe areas of Reading and Math on the Interim MAP Assessment with 50% or better of your students.\r•Increase English Learners’ reclassification rate by 2% annually.\r•Increase the status of the English Learner Progress Indicator(ELPI) by 2% annually.\r•Progressively increase high school graduation rates to 90% for all students with an emphasis on African American
column4: English Learner\rand Special Education student groups as measured by the CA School Dashboard.\r•Decrease high school dropout rate by 2% annually with an emphasis on African American
column6: English Learner and Special Education\rstudent groups.\r•Progressively increase the A-G course completion rate to 65% with an emphasis on African American
column8: English Learner and Special\rEducation student groups.\r•Attain a 50% AP qualifying score rate of 3+ for all students with an emphasis on African American and Hispanic students.\r•Attain an 85% FAFSA Completion Rate.\r•Increase the High School Readiness Indicator by 10% annually.\r•Address Middle School Readiness by increasing the percent of students scoring Average or above on the MAP Reading Assessment by 5%\rannually.\r•Decrease suspension rate for Foster Youth* and African American* students by 2% annually.\r•Meet or exceed 95% attendance rate for all students.\r•Decrease the chronic absenteeism rate for all students by 2% annually.\r\rThe MVUSD Professional Development and Digital Learning Department develops and implements a wide variety of sessions to support staff members\ras they grow and extend their skillsets in providing highly-effective instruction to ensure student success and meet the goals and outcomes mentioned\rabove. These sessions include

column18: developing curriculum guides/scope and sequence documents
column19: implementing programs focused on grade level academic content\rstandards

column23: designing coaching/training for individual school site needs
column24: and addressing special needs students. Further
column25: the department focuses on the\ranalysis of teaching (effectiveness) and student learning
column27: and the integration of technology. There are twenty-nine Professional\rDevelopment Specialists who serve MVUSD's thirty-nine school sites. They receive high-level coaching training support the Professional Learning\rCommunities model and are available for assistance with implementation on all campuses.  ... Unnamed: 6
